intro: Helianthemum almeriense, commonly known as the Almería rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Helianthemum almeriense is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and is often used in rock gardens or as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
